_chemical.ChemicalName: Vinyl acetate monomer  [Acetic acid ethenyl ester]

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PURPOSE FOR RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN SUBMISSION / UPDATE

Stolthaven Houston Inc. is updating the facility's Risk Management Plan (RMP) in April of 2009 to reflect a new facility operating scenario for a regulated substance and to update various other RMP program elements.  The changes associated with this RMP update include:

- Updating the RMP pursuant to the requirements of Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations Part 68 (40 CFR 68), Section ? 68.190(b)(4), due to Stolthaven Houston Inc. commencing the storage and associated marine parcel shipments of Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM) above the threshold quantity of 15,000-pounds.  
- Updating the name and contact information for Stolthaven Houston's General Manager, who is currently responsible for 40 CFR Part 68 RMP implementation.
- Updating the name of Stolthaven Houston's parent company, which changed on December 1, 2007.

?68.155(a):  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

At Stolthaven Houston Inc. we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes involved in chemical storage and distribution in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning programs to protect the environment and to help ensure the safety of our employees as well at the citizens of the surrounding communities.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that Stolthaven Houston Inc. has designed and implemented, including:

- A description of our facility and the substances regulated by 40 CFR Part 68 that are handled on-site
- An overview of our accidental release prevention programs
- A five-year accident history for accidental releases of processes covered by EPA's RMP rule
- An overview of our emergency response program
- An overview of improvements at the facility to help prevent accidental chemical releases from occurring and adversely affecting our employees, the public, the environment, and

company assets
- Detailed information (i.e. data elements) about our Risk Management Program


?68.155(b):  STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Our facility currently stores Acrylonitrile and Toluene Diisocyanate (TDI) in large, above-ground storage tanks.  These products are received into the Stolthaven Houston Terminal by various modes of transportation cargo containers that can include tank trucks, ISO tank containers, rail cars, barges, and/or marine parcel tankers (ships), are stored on-site according to customer requirements, and then are subsequently transferred off-site through one of more of the above-referenced transportation modes.  Direct transfer of TDI from marine vessels to rail tank cars is also performed at Stolthaven Houston Inc. with no intermdeiate storage of the product.  Isopentane, n-Pentane, and pentane blends are also transloaded at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal with no intermediate product storge.  

Beginning in April of 2009, Stolthaven Houston Inc. will commence the storage and associated marine transfers of Vinyl Acetate Monomer (VAM), a RMP regulated toxic substance, in quantities greater than 15,000-pounds.  After initial system commissioning via tank truck delivery, VAM will subsequently be received into the Stolthaven Houston Terminal via barges that will discharge at Barge Dock-C into two existing 15,000-barrel capacity internal floating roof (IFR) Storage Tanks:  Tanks A15-9 and A15-10.  The stored VAM will subsequently be shipped outbound according to customer requirements via marine parcel tankers that will load at Stolthaven Houston's existing Ship Dock 2/3.

Employee training related to the specifics of VAM storage and transfer at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal was conducted in December of 2008 and again in early April of 2009 in preparation of receiving this product into the facility.  As a result of the upcoming VAM storage and transfer a new piping manifold was also constructed in A Tank Farm to allow pr

oduct storage in either Tank A15-9 or A15-10 without the need to use hoses to divert product to either tank.

Note that the Stolthaven Houston Terminal does not perform any chemical processing or chemical manufacturing operations on-site.

The following chemicals handled at Stolthaven Houston have been identified by the EPA as having the potential to cause significant off-site consequences in the event of a substantial accidental release:

Regulated Toxic Substances (3):

Acrylonitrile (CAS Number 107-13-1),
Toluene Diisocyanate (CAS Number 26471-62-5), &
Vinyl Acetate Monomer (CAS Number 108-05-4)

Regulated Flammable Substances (2):

Normal Pentane (CAS No. 563-46-2)
Isopentane (CAS No. 563-46-2), &
Normal Pentane (> 45%) / Isopentane (< 55%) Blend

Our accidental release prevention programs and our contingency planning efforts help us effectively manage the potential hazards that are posed to our employees, the public, and the environment by the storage and/or transfer of these chemicals. 

   
?68.155[c]:  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention programs, including:

- Process Safety Information (PSI)
- Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
- ISO 9001: 2000 Certified Quality Management System (QMS)
- Employee Training/Local Training Manual
- Mechanical Integrity Program
- Spill Containment
- Management of Change (MOC)
- Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR)
- Vapor Control Systems
- Compliance Audits
- Formal Incident Investigation
- Employee Participation Program
- Hot Work/Safe Work Permits
- Departmental/Safety Meetings
- Terminal Safety Committee
- Emergency Response Team (ERT)
- Emergency/Incident Response Contractors

The above-referenced elements of our prevention program work together to help prevent accidental chemical releases.  Our company and our e

mployees are committed to the standard that these management systems set for the way we conduct business, and we have specific accountabilities and controls in place to ensure that we meet our own high standards for accident prevention.


?68.155(d):  FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

During the preceding five (5) years there have been no accidental releases from RMP covered processes at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal which resulted in death, injuries, or siginificant property damage on-site.  Similarly, there have been no accidental releases from any RMP covered processes which resulted in known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

All incidents and non-routine releases at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal are formally investigated as part of our facility's ISO Quality Management System to identify and correct the root cause(s) of the event, and to implement appropriate corrective actions for continuous process improvement.


?68.155(e):  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

We maintain an integrated contingency plan, which consolidates the various federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  Our program provides the essential planning and training for effectively protecting our employees, the public, the environment, and company assets during potential emergency situations.  Furthermore, we coordinate our action plan with the community emergency response plan and the North Channel Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).

An Emergency Action Plan (EAP) is maintained which provides guidelines for responding to various emergencies such as fires, hazardous material spills, personal injuries, and property damage that may originate at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal.  


?68.155(f):  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The following is a list of improvements that are implemented at the Stolthaven Houston Terminal to prevent and/or better respond to accidental chemical releases:

-

PHA and adaptation of PHA recommendations
- Continuous improvement through the facility's ISO 9001: 2000 Certified Quality Management System (QMS)
- Employee Suggestion/Experience Feedback Program
- Regular safety meetings with Stolthaven Houston operations employees and contract personnel working in the Stolthaven Houston Terminal
- Facility Safety Committee
